meanings.definition: Paying excessive attention to detail; fussy or finicky.
meanings.sent1: She was very finicking about arranging the flowers just right.
meanings.sent2: The finicking cat refused to eat anything but a specific brand of food.
meanings.sent3: The finicking chef insisted on using only organic ingredients in the dish.
meanings.sent4: Her finicking nature when it came to choosing colors made her an excellent interior designer.
meanings.sent5: The finicking tailor spent hours perfecting every stitch on the dress.

meanings.definition: Showing or requiring great attention to detail; finicky.
meanings.sent1: The artist's finicking brush strokes added depth to the painting.
meanings.sent2: The finicking customer returned the shirt because of a tiny loose thread.
meanings.sent3: His finicking behavior about his desk organization amused his coworkers.
meanings.sent4: The finicking clockmaker crafted each gear with precision and care.
meanings.sent5: The finicking student meticulously checked every answer on the test.

meanings.definition: To fuss over or worry about small details; finicking.
meanings.sent1: She would finicking over the seating arrangement for hours before the party.
meanings.sent2: He tends to finicking about the font size on his presentations.
meanings.sent3: The bride's mother finicking over the flower arrangements for the wedding.
meanings.sent4: Don't finicking too much about the minor details; focus on the big picture.
meanings.sent5: The director would finicking over every scene in the movie production.
